summary: Today’s PaymentsDive recap: 8 new stories, with focus on fraud/security, regulation.

articles.title: Why virtual cards can be safer than plastic
articles.description: Many companies are swapping plastic payment cards for virtual because they’re less prone to fraud, Boost Payments Chief Revenue Officer Seth Goodman said.

articles.title: Cash App debuts payment links
articles.description: After PayPal debuted a similar feature last year, Cash App also wants to simplify payment requests for users.

articles.title: Cash App to sell its credit score
articles.description: Block on Thursday opened up a waitlist for companies that want to access deeper insights from its Cash App consumer scoring.

articles.title: Bill weighs the best path to profits
articles.description: Business payments company Bill Holdings is mulling a sale, according to a media report, as recent B2B fintech deals show ample buyer interest.

articles.title: JPMorgan, Nacha to share data via blockchain
articles.description: The companies aim to simplify the account verification process for JPMorgan Chase customers.

articles.title: GAO details CFPB’s downsizing
articles.description: The scope of the CFPB’s downsizing were explored in two reports released Monday, one of which concludes that the changes cost consumers $19 billion.

articles.title: Merchants seek hearing on card pact
articles.description: Large retailers opposing a swipe-fee settlement with Visa and Mastercard want a judge to hear oral arguments before he rules on the proposal.

articles.title: Judge backs Illinois law on card fees
articles.description: A U.S. judge ruled that federal bank law doesn’t preempt an Illinois effort to ban card interchange fees on sales tax and tips. Bank groups vowed to appeal.
